TopicTitle: Wake up tomorrow; and any Sci-fi / Fantasy universe is true.

Articles.Content:
BUT you have to be the villain... Which would you choose?

 

I'd have to become a renegade starship captain in Star Trek.

You know, there's no garuantee that if I said "Star Trek Original Series" that I'd be Kirk or Spock or whatever, I might end up a redshirt or blasted in my bartending job by an angry Kilingon.

 

I'd have to say - I'd like to wake up in the middle of the "Golden Age" that preceded the "Age of Strife" which preceded the war-torn Warhammer 40K universe.

The golden age was several millenia of technological perfection, post-scarcity, we dominated the galaxy. No scary Chaos monsters, no Tyranids, what aliens there were were mercilessly exterminated. Sure, maybe a few thousand years after I die of old age, mankind goes to heck, but what do i care? My house is a hollowed out mountain and I have a pet battle-titan. I assume.

 

*edit*

ooh I skipped ahead and didn't read the "villain" part.

Lets say the same thing but Im a dictatorial planetary governor. I keep the people down, but not so down that they fancy messing with my pet

Edited May 20, 2016 by p1t1o
dur stooped
i cant see how anyone would say anything other than Star Wars.

1 more hole in my brain and i open a goulf stream

Interstellar as Matt Damon. It would be pretty cool to go out in a blaze of glory in space.

Edited May 22, 2016 by Spartwo
Star Wars, as Mitth'raw'nuruodo, also known by his core name Thrawn, who worked his way up to Grand Admiral. At least I'd know not to trust those Noghri

I had to give this one a lot of thought...  it's a really good question!
My first choice... well, mine, of course!  I want to be Thompberry Kerman, the brain-pod... lol... 

But seriously, if I have to be the villain, then I'm going all the way and dive head first into anarchy...

I choose to be The Joker in the Batman universe...  bwaahahahaha

Oh, no, it definitely has to be the infinite improbability drive. No doubt about it. If you are going to violate all the known laws of physics the IID is they way to go. I don't have to spend 3years crossing the galaxy stopping to get food and fight aliens when i can just have a wierd thought and be on the otherside of the universe. You can have betasid in every galaxy.

I'll be the 

Spoiler

protomolecule

in The Expanse. I mean, how cool is it to 

Spoiler

be an entire moon, and then crash it into Venus, and then turn into a portal?!

You just can't beat that.

Question; does Undertale count as a "fantasy" universe?
